Modules

Pool References

Modules

 util_pool_initialize
 util_pool_async_insert
 util_pool_async_query
 util_pool_sync_insert
 util_pool_sync_query

Detailed Description

A pool is a set of initialised resources that are kept ready to use, rather than allocated and destroyed on demand. A client of the pool will request an object from the pool and perform operations on the returned object. When the client has finished with an object (or resource), it returns it to the pool, rather than destroying it.

The Libutil - Pool functionality allows the initialization of the pool, the request (query) and return (insertion) of objects. It is OS independent by using the OSAL (Operating System Abstraction Layer) library for locking and unlocking of critical sections. After the initialization of the pool it is filled with unused objects which can be queried for use.

The pool functionality is implemented discretly in this component. So it is not possible to suspend a calling thread on an unsuccessful query request (e.g. when the pool is empty). The number of needed objects has to be determined before the use of the pool.

Routines:

  • util_pool_initialize - ...
  • util_pool_async_insert - ...
  • util_pool_async_query - ...
  • util_pool_sync_insert - ...
  • util_pool_sync_query - ...
